q:
In Shell Scripting, if you are editing the lines from a file by using the vi editor, then which of the following statements about the vi terminal commands in this scenario are correct:
1) The vi - ~ command is used to switch the case of the character under the cursor.
2) The vi - U command is used to undo the last change that was done in the file.
3) The vi - J command is used to join the current line with the next line.
4) The vi -:f command is used to display the current position in the file in % and the file name.

In Shell Scripting, if you are required to change the characters or the lines in a file without deleting them by using the vi editor, then which of the following statements about the vi terminal commands in this scenario are correct:
1) The ‘cc’ command is used to remove the contents of the line in the insert mode.
2) The ‘r’ command is used to overwrite the multiple characters beginning with the character currently under the cursor.
3) The ‘S’ command is used to delete the line the cursor is on and replaces the line with the new text.
4) The ‘cw’ command is used to change the word that the cursor is on from the cursor to the lowercase w end of the word.

In Shell Scripting, you are working on the screen and the page layouts by using the vi editor. Which of the following control commands in this scenario are correct:
1) The CTRL+d command is used to move the ¼ screen forward.
2) The CTRL+f command is used to move the ½ screen backward.
3) The CTRl+b command is used to move the full screen backward.
4) The CTRL+e command is used to move the screen up one line.
5) The CTRL+y command is used to move the screen down one line.

In Shell Scripting, if you are required to delete the characters in a file by using the vi editor, then which of the following statements about the deletion operations are correct:
1) The d^ command is used to delete the characters that are available from the current cursor position to the beginning of the line
2) The d$ command is used to delete the characters that are available from the current cursor position to the end of the line.
3) The d~ command is used to delete the characters that are available from the current cursor location to the next word.
4) The D command is used to delete the characters that are available from the cursor position to the end of the current line.

In Shell Scripting, if you are required to perform the copy-paste operations on a file by using the vi editor, then which of the following statements about the terminal commands in this scenario are correct:
1) The ‘yx’ command is used to copy the current line.
2) The ‘yw’ command is used to copy the current word from the character that contains the lowercase w cursor is on
3) The ‘p’ command is used to place the copied text after the cursor.
4) The ‘P’ command is used to place the yanked text before the cursor.
